commentary_central: The majority of the FOMC concur that weakness in labour markets outweighs inflation concerns and is sufficient to go ahead with a quarter point cut
commentary_higher: The Fed dismisses data that shows the job market has weakened and maintains its hawkish fears around tariff inflation keeping rates on hold
commentary_lower: Worries about the labour market are much worse than expected and prompted by a bad set of jobs data for August that spurs the FOMC into a half point cut

commentary_central: The Fed returns to wait-and-see mode with tension between its price stability and maximum employment elements of its mandate
commentary_higher: Does not cut in September and continues holding as inflation and jobs numbers come in higher than expected
commentary_lower: Unemployment rises quickly towards 4.5 per cent and pushes the Fed to cut again

commentary_central: The Fed cuts rates once or twice in 2025 as labour market weakness forces it to act
commentary_higher: The Fed remains on hold all year as inflation heats up and the unemployment rate fails to significantly rise
commentary_lower: Tariff inflation remains limited allowing the Fed to move faster in response to a fast rise in unemployment

commentary_central: The Fed eases at a quarterly pace
commentary_higher: Inflationary results of tariffs and the US budget require interest rates to stay higher or rise
commentary_lower: Clear weakness in the real economy leads to the faster pace of cuts

commentary_central: The Fed continues a path of easing to neutral
commentary_higher: Inflationary policies require interest rates to stay higher or rise
commentary_lower: Weakness in real economy leads to faster pace of cuts or a lower estimate of neutral rates

commentary_central: Interest rates converge on a rate similar to the long-term trend growth of the US economy plus inflation, although the path towards these rates might be bumpy with long periods outside the range.
commentary_higher: Strong growth or a growing lack of confidence in US public finances requires a higher neutral interest rate.
commentary_lower: Weak and persistently low growth generates few outside options for savings, helping the longer-term interest rate to fall to low levels.
